creator: Qtechknow
title: Arduino ADK LED Lighting
materials_required: USB-B Cable for Arduino ADK Programming
description: This project demonstrates how to use the Arduino ADK (Android Development Kit) to control LED strips with an Android device. It involves using the Handbag app for Android, which simplifies the process by allowing you to control the Arduino ADK's I/O pins without writing any Android code.
steps: Gather the required parts and tools, including the Arduino Mega ADK, USB-B cable, LED strip, transistor, relay, diode, resistor, breadboard, power adapter, and jumper wires.
Download and install the Handbag app on your Android device and enable USB debugging in the developer options.

Craft a base for the LED strip and solder the GND and +12V connections for the LED strips. Solder wires to the + and - sides of the LED strip and optionally add a switch in series to the positive side.
Assemble the relay circuit on the breadboard according to the provided Fritzing diagram, connecting the transistor, resistor, relay, and LED strip to the Arduino ADK.
Download and install the required Arduino libraries (AndroidAccessory.zip, Handbag.zip, and ledStripADK.zip).
Open the ledStripADK.ino file in the Arduino IDE and upload the code to the Arduino ADK.
Plug the USB cable into the Arduino ADK, connect the 12V DC power adapter to the JST connector, and plug in your Android phone with the Handbag app running.
Test the setup by pressing the 'Turn LED Strip On' and 'Turn LED Strip Off' buttons in the Handbag app. The relay should click and the LED strip should light up or turn off accordingly.
